title: Fans mock Arsenal's Nicholas Pepe following glaring miss against Sheffield United
text:
Arsenal record signing Nicolas Pepe had nowhere to hide at Bramall Lane on Monday night, after missing a glaring chance to put his side into the lead.

The Gunners went on to lose the game to newly promoted Sheffield United, and the £72million Ivorian soon bore the brunt of the blame.

Pepe had gone agonsingly close after making a strong near post run to latch onto the end of Sead Kolasinac's cross, but made the ill-judged error of going for the ball with his left foot and connecting with thin air as a result.

Arsenal's record signing Nicolas Pepe saw the ball ghost across him against Sheffield United

The winger went to connect with the cross with his left foot, instead of trusting his right

The 24-year-old was left with his head in his hands, with the missed sitter becoming even more of a talking point after the Gunners went on to lose the game.

Pepe has just one goal to his name so far for Unai Emery's side, coming by the way of the penalty spot.

In nine Arsenal league appearances so far, things have not yet clicked for the summer arrival from Lille.

As criticism poured in the direction of the winger on social media, comparisons were quickly drawn to the underwhelming spell of Gervinho in an Arsenal shirt.

Gervinho, who played for the Gunners between 2011 and 2013, missed a similarly glaringly obvious chance against Bradford in 2012.

Pepe was immediately criticised by football fans following the glaringly obvious miss

Comparisons were immediately drawn with the underwhelming Gervinho, vs Bradford in 2012

Pepe is just Gervinho with a better hairline #SHUARS pic.twitter.com/jFw0SN68Rs — Football Survivor (@footiesurvivor) October 21, 2019

What I see whenever I watch Nicolas Pepe play: pic.twitter.com/yFxFylj860 — Henry Orji (@Hunccho) October 21, 2019

Similarities were then made between the two players hailing from the same nation, and playing in roughly the same position on the pitch.

Jibes were then aimed in the general direction of Arsenal with rival fans poking fun at the club having bought 'another version of Gervinho'.

Emery broke the bank to sign Pepe in the summer window, despite Arsenal operating on a shoestring budget.

A £72m fee was agreed with Lille to make the winger Arsenal's most costly ever purchase, with the total transfer to be paid in a long series of installments.

Arsenal are paying Nicolas Pepe’s fee in installments. That’s why he decided to perform in installment too.#SHUARS — Zoba K Yamah (@UtdChi) October 21, 2019
description: Arsenal record signing Nicholas Pepe had nowhere to hide at Brammall Lane on Monday night, after missing a glaring chance to put his side into the lead.
